prince_andrew_duke_of_york.name: Prince Andrew, Duke of York
prince_andrew_duke_of_york.summary: Second son of Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip. Served in Royal Navy including Falklands War. Accused by Virginia Giuffre of sexual assault when she was 17. Settled civil lawsuit in 2022. Stepped back from royal duties in 2019.

donald_trump.name: Donald John Trump
donald_trump.summary: Real estate developer, television personality, and 45th President of the United States (2017-2021). Was a social acquaintance of Jeffrey Epstein in the 1990s and early 2000s in Palm Beach, Florida, social circles. Trump reportedly banned Epstein from Mar-a-Lago in 2007 after alleged misconduct.

adriana_mucinska.name: Adriana Ross (also known as Adriana Mucinska)
adriana_mucinska.summary: Polish former model who worked as key assistant to Epstein. Accused of facilitating trafficking operation and obstructing justice. Granted immunity in 2008 agreement, never charged.

marvin_minsky.name: Marvin Lee Minsky
marvin_minsky.summary: Pioneering MIT artificial intelligence researcher who accepted Epstein funding and maintained friendship. Organized academic events on Epstein's island. Alleged by Virginia Giuffre to have been involved in trafficking, denied by widow. Died in 2016.

kevin_spacey.name: Kevin Spacey Fowler
kevin_spacey.summary: Academy Award-winning actor who participated in 2002 Epstein plane trip to Africa for AIDS charity work alongside Clinton. Has stated he didn't know Epstein and never visited his properties. No Epstein-related allegations.

jeanluc_brunel.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
jeanluc_brunel.summary: French model scout and founder of MC2 Model Management, which was financially backed by Jeffrey Epstein. Accused of sexual assault spanning three decades and of recruiting young women for Epstein's trafficking operation. Found dead in French prison cell in 2022 while awaiting trial.

glenn_dubin.name: Glenn Russell Dubin
glenn_dubin.summary: Billionaire hedge fund manager with long personal and financial ties to Epstein through wife Eva (Epstein's ex-girlfriend). Denied allegations by Virginia Giuffre. Retired from hedge fund industry in 2020.

william_richardson.name: William Blaine Richardson III
william_richardson.summary: Former New Mexico governor and UN ambassador alleged by Virginia Giuffre to have been involved in Epstein's trafficking operation. Richardson denied allegations. Never charged with crimes. Died in 2023.

alan_dershowitz.name: Alan Morton Dershowitz
alan_dershowitz.summary: Prominent criminal defense attorney and Harvard Law School professor emeritus. Represented Jeffrey Epstein in 2008 plea deal negotiations. Accused by Virginia Giuffre of sexual abuse, which he denied; Giuffre later settled and said she may have been mistaken. Continues to deny all allegations.

doug_band.name: Douglas Jay Band
doug_band.summary: Former top advisor to Bill Clinton who was key architect of Clinton's post-presidency. Flew on Epstein's plane multiple times during humanitarian work period. Later claimed he warned Clinton about Epstein.

virginia_roberts.name: Virginia Louise Giuffre (née Roberts)
virginia_roberts.summary: Survivor of Epstein's trafficking operation who became prominent advocate for victims. First to publicly identify herself (2011). Filed lawsuits against Epstein, Maxwell, Prince Andrew, and others. Tragically died by suicide in 2025.

leslie_wexner.name: Leslie Herbert Wexner
leslie_wexner.summary: Billionaire businessman who founded L Brands, parent company of Victoria's Secret and Bath & Body Works. Employed Jeffrey Epstein as his personal financial manager from 1987 to 2007, granting him broad power of attorney. Stated Epstein misappropriated vast sums of his money.

william_clinton.name: William Jefferson Clinton
william_clinton.summary: 42nd President of the United States, serving from 1993 to 2001. Known for economic prosperity during his presidency and founding the Clinton Foundation. Documented to have flown on Jeffrey Epstein's private aircraft multiple times in the early 2000s for Clinton Foundation humanitarian work.

larry_visoski.name: Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr. (known as 'Captain Bigdawg')
larry_visoski.summary: Longtime pilot for Jeffrey Epstein who flew hundreds of trips carrying high-profile passengers. Testified at Maxwell trial about flight operations but stated he never witnessed illegal activity.

nadia.name: Nadia Marcinko (born Nada Marcinkova)
nadia.summary: Slovak-born pilot and CEO who transitioned from modeling to aviation. Named in Epstein case with disputed role as both potential victim and alleged facilitator.

emmy_tayler.name: Emmy Tayler
emmy_tayler.summary: British actress and former personal assistant to Ghislaine Maxwell from 1997-2001. Named in Epstein-related documents but successfully challenged false allegations through legal action.

sarah_kellen.name: Sarah Kellen (also known as Sarah Vickers, Sarah Kensington)
sarah_kellen.summary: Former assistant to Jeffrey Epstein described in court testimony as gatekeeper who scheduled appointments and managed operations. Now interior designer married to Brian Vickers. Has claimed she was also a victim of Epstein's abuse.

ghislaine_maxwell.name: Ghislaine Noelle Marion Maxwell
ghislaine_maxwell.summary: British socialite and convicted sex trafficker. Daughter of publishing magnate Robert Maxwell. Long-time associate of Jeffrey Epstein. Convicted in 2021 of sex trafficking of minors and sentenced to 20 years in federal prison in 2022.

jeffrey_epstein.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
jeffrey_epstein.summary: American financier and convicted sex offender who managed money for wealthy clients. Convicted in 2008 in Florida on charges of procuring a minor for prostitution. Arrested again in 2019 on federal charges of sex trafficking of minors. Died in federal custody in 2019 while awaiting trial.
